intro: Argyrochosma dealbata, commonly known as the white-stemmed rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as slopes and cliffs. Argyrochosma dealbata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with limited soil moisture.
